dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, so, uh, big news coming out of the aviation world today.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, so, uh, big news coming out of the aviation world today.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah? What's up? Like, another airline going bankrupt or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah? What's up? Like, another airline going bankrupt or something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, thankfully not that. It's actually about Air Astana and FlyArystan. They've decided to, um, bypass Iranian and Iraqi airspace.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, thankfully not that. It's actually about Air Astana and FlyArystan. They've decided to, um, bypass Iranian and Iraqi airspace.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has been reported that Air Astana and FlyArystan have decided to bypass the airspace of Iran and Iraq.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, really? That's... that's a pretty significant move. Where did this come from?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, really? That's... that's a pretty significant move. Where did this come from?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally. They, uh, put out a statement on their Telegram channel, actually. Said it was due to the "closure" of that airspace.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally. They, uh, put out a statement on their Telegram channel, actually. Said it was due to the closure of that airspace.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Details were published on the company™s Telegram channel. We inform our customers about changes to the routes of certain regular and charter flights by Air Astana and FlyArystan due to the closure of Iranian and Iraqi airspace.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so which flights are we talking about here? Is it, like, all of them, or specific routes?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so which flights are we talking about here? Is it, like, all of them, or specific routes?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good question. It's specific ones – Sharm El Sheikh, Dubai, Doha, and Medina. So, you know, those key Middle Eastern destinations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good question. It's specific ones - Sharm El Sheikh, Dubai, Doha, and Medina. So, you know, those key Middle Eastern destinations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Flights to Sharm El Sheikh, Dubai, Doha, and Medina will be operated bypassing the airspace of Iran and Iraq, the airline stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And I guess passengers should really be checking their flight status, then, because departure and arrival times are probably [overlaps] going to be all over the place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And I guess passengers should really be checking their flight status, then, because departure and arrival times are probably going to be all over the place.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company also advised passengers to check the status of their flights, as departure and arrival times may change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Absolutely, they explicitly advised that. But, um, I mean, we know *why* this is happening, right? The situation in the Middle East has just, like, massively escalated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely, they explicitly advised that. But, um, I mean, we know why this is happening, right? The situation in the Middle East has just, like, massively escalated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I was just thinking that. I mean, we saw that massive Israeli airstrike on Iran just a few days ago, on June 13th, remember?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I was just thinking that. I mean, we saw that massive Israeli airstrike on Iran just a few days ago, on June thirteenth, remember?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Let us recall that on the morning of June 13, Israel carried out a massive airstrike on Iran.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, and Iran, like, immediately promised a harsh response. And then, uh, it came out they launched, what, over a hundred drones at Israel?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, and Iran, like, immediately promised a harsh response. And then, uh, it came out they launched, what, over a hundred drones at Israel?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Iran has already promised a harsh response to the Israeli attacks. Later, it became known that Iran launched more than 100 drones at Israel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, it's pretty clear these airlines are, you know, taking precautions because of all that heightened tension. Safety first, obviously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, it's pretty clear these airlines are, you know, taking precautions because of all that heightened tension. Safety first, obviously.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And on top of that, Host_B, the Kazakhstan Embassy in Israel has actually put out a message for its citizens too, with emergency contact lines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And on top of that, Host B, the Kazakhstan Embassy in Israel has actually put out a message for its citizens too, with emergency contact lines.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Embassy of Kazakhstan in Israel issued a message to its citizens amid the escalating situation in the Middle East. Emergency contact lines of the Kazakh Embassy in Israel are open for citizens:

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That really underscores the seriousness of, uh, everything happening over there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That really underscores the seriousness of, uh, everything happening over there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a developing situation, for sure. So, if you're flying to any of those regions, definitely keep an eye on your airline's updates.
